title: Sunshine
instructions:
This exercise introduces you to the `circle` function.

### Drawing Circles

To draw circles, we use the `circle` function with 4 inputs:

- `x`: The x position of the center of the circle
- `y`: The y position of the center of the circle
- `radius`: How big the circle is
- `color`: The color of the circle (a hex string like `"#ffed06"`)

## Instructions

We've drawn a light blue sky and some sun spikes for you. Don't worry about the triangles yet - we'll cover those separately shortly!

Your job is to draw the sun itself by adding a yellow circle in the center of the canvas.

The top-left of the drawing canvas is `0,0`. The bottom-right is `100,100`. You can hover over the canvas to check coordinates.
hints: The circle function takes 4 arguments: x, y, radius, color
The sun should be centered in the middle of the canvas at (50, 50)
Use the same yellow as the spikes: "#ffed06"
